alert.note: Alert for Susquehanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 11:09AM EST until January 14 at 11:15AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM EST FOR SOUTHWESTERN OTSEGO...SOUTHEASTERN BROOME...NORTHWESTERN DELAWARE... EASTERN CHENANGO AND NORTHERN SUSQUEHANNA COUNTIES... At 1109 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Pittsfield to Brackney, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highway exits... New York Interstate 81 between 1 and 3. Interstate 86/Route 17 between 75 and 82. Interstate 88 between 4 and 13. Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 223 and 230. Locations impacted include... Oneonta, Kirkwood, Conklin, Sidney, Guilford, Sanford, Hartwick, Susquehanna, Westville, and Coventry. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
